description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the NTFS elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-38117), it is essential to apply the latest updates provided by Microsoft.

1. Access the Microsoft Update Catalog.

2. Download the appropriate KB articles based on your system build:
   - For Windows 10 (x64): Apply KB5041782.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: Apply KB5041580.
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: Apply KB5041592.
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: Apply KB5041585.
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: Apply KB5041585.
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2: Apply KB5041571.

3. Install the updates following the on-screen prompts.

4. Restart your system to ensure changes take effect.

**Details**:
These updates resolve vulnerabilities in NTFS that could allow an attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system. Ensure to verify the specific build number to select the correct update package before proceeding with installation. For further information on each update, please refer to the following links:
- [KB5041782](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041782)
- [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)
- [KB5041580](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)
- [KB5041571](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041571)
- [KB5041592](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041592)

**Preconditions**:
- Confirm that the system is running a supported version of Windows.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
